conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force at t = 2.5 seconds.
A single-turn square wire frame is placed on a horizontal surface with half in a magnetic field.
Side length of wire frame is 0.2m, resistance is 4Ω, magnetic field B = (3 + 2t) T.
Calculate area of wire frame: 0.2 x 0.2 = 0.04 m².
Effective area in magnetic field: 0.04 / 2 = 0.02 m².
Induced current I = ε / R = 0.04 / 4 = 0.01 A.
Magnetic force F = I x L x B = 0.01 x 0.2 x 8 = 0.0016 N.
Direction of magnetic force is to the right; frictional force must act to the left.
Magnitude of frictional force at t = 2.5 s is 0.0016 N, direction is to the left.
